Reviews.Title: “Room is nice but a little far from train station”
Reviews.Author: Kai W
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Roma in late night and It really took a long way to this hotel which is located in Vatican where you only take metro or taxi to get.To summrize,the room is nice and the facility is basic.Nice bathroom only with shower but a little small.The staff is not at your serve all the time,while,you could get what you request on your ask.You can find a water machine in the hall get some hotwater to drink.If you have to ask something we are not glad about,we could not find a person to help us with check-out and cashier on the day when we departed from roma to venice!

Reviews.Title: “Good value near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine697
Reviews.Content: Close to subway, pizza, supermarket, gelato, with great breakfast place across the street. They made arrangements for a taxi to take us to airport. We stayed 4 nights and visited the entire city. This hotel worked out fine for us. Some rooms have private baths and some have shared baths. We had private baths, which were very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Kim L
Reviews.Content: Great clean comfortable accommodations. Good value, free wifi, good location (a few blocks away from the metro station and from the Vatican). There is a supermarket half a block away and a great little gelato place down the street. Our room had a sink, closet, decent bed and a view of the street. The shared bathroom is clean. There is a coffee and water dispenser that offers unlimited drinks in the hallway. They offer bicycles but the tires were flat so we couldn’t use them. I would stay here again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: OzzieHolliday
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for Rome. It is walking distance to the Vatican and close to a metro stop (so you can get to the colosseum etc). It's also right next to a pizza takeaway place, a small supermarket and an ATM in a secure neighbourhood. They will send a taxi to pick you up from the airport for 40 Euro which is also worth taking advantage of (most ordinary taxis have never heard of it and have trouble finding it so bring the address and directions if using another taxi). The room was a good size, particularly for Europe (i.e..you could actually close the door and still be standing in the room), it had air con, and the shower was hot with good pressure and was a separate cubicle with a door so you didn't get water everywhere (all of this is REALLY rare in Europe budget hotels!). The room was also very clean, well kept and very nice for the price. We did have one of the nicest rooms with an ensuite but we peeked in other rooms and they seemed similar (although some had no air con and/or no ensuite). The staff were overall very friendly and helpful. Some of the towels were too thin, but they were always large. There is a lift (also rare for Europe budget hotels) but it is very small. No breakfast, but there is a free cappucino machine. Wifi is free and good. I would definitely come back: it's a great place to use as a base to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Toastillicus
Reviews.Content: I decided to end my backpacking trip by splurging on a hotel in Rome for my last few days. It turned out to be not much of a splurge as (in September at least) this place cost only 10 euro more a night for a double with ensuite than my bunk at a higher end hostel. One of the reviews below mentions cab drivers not knowing the hotel, but this would be true for many smaller hotels in Rome, bring the address and you'll be fine. It's actually easy walking distance from the Metro even with bags anyway and the train from the airport drops you right on the metro line to the place anyway. Choice of room levels, bigger and smaller, lots of neat little cafes nearby and all of a 5 minute walk from the Vatican museum and barely farther to St. Peter's. Five minute walk to the metro as well which will easily take you to any other sight in rome. Cappucino machine in the hall as well as filtered water (a lifesaver in Rome's heat and cold drink extortion market.) Basically a clean, well kept place to have a relaxing quiet sleep to recharge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful people, good cappucino”
Reviews.Author: SurenRao
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 liked the hotel and room - very secure, good cappunico machine saves time from going outside for this, near train station Octavviano and Bus Stop and 5 min walk from vatican. Helpful staff for directions - we enjoyed taking public transportation - the adventure. The rooms were kept clean . When you look out of the window you see Rome as a city that you would live in..loved it. Will go again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: NotJeff
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the the hotel was very nice, and the hotel was situated in a very good location (a ten-minute walk to the Vatican, and a 5ish minute walk to the nearest metro station). It really doesn't look like all that much from the outside, and the small elevator makes it difficult to bring large quantities of luggage to the floor on which the hotel is located, but overall it's a gem of a hotel. The only minor complaints I would have is that there is no hairdryer in the bathroom (though they will give you one if you request it), and it tends to be rather noisy at night (cars, people, and so forth). Aside from that, however, our stay was very pleasant, and I would definitely choose the hotel again. Also, regarding the location, while it is only a ten-minute walk away from the Vatican, it's amazingly far enough away that it isn't infected by tourists. There are two really good, authentic restaurants that are essentially on the same block as the hotel where everyone eating there (save my family and I) seemed to be local.

Reviews.Title: “Very uncomfortable and small”
Reviews.Author: dansue4
Reviews.Content: For $150, book another facility. This hotel is ridiculously small. I am a very small woman, and I couldn't even fit comfortably in the shower. There was six inches from the toilet to the shower. The bed felt like sleeping on wood and the pillows were the worst ever. I had to fold up my bathrobe to use as a pillow. There was no soap or shampoo provided. The towels were comparable to sheets or table linen. On the positive side, it was very clean and had a wonderful coffee shop right across the street. There are many other hotels in Rome at this price that are much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SUPERBigRED23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the final leg of our honeymoon. Positives: Clean room. All the Basics. Air conditioned. In what appears to be a regular neighborhood. Close to the Vatican. Computer w/ internet access. Helpful and friendly staff. Pretty close to the Metro. Awesome Price! Negatives: Far away from most of the action. Being that it was our last leg of the honeymoon it would have been nice to be close to everything so that we could take in parts of the city at a time and be able to come back to the hotel for relaxation before heading back out and seeing Rome at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful neighborhood-walk to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: annacatherine
Reviews.Content: No breakfast (hot water/tea/instant coffee only) served in this two star (because some rooms had outside bath?), but we loved going across the street to the neighborhood bar for coffee every morning to see the same locals(seemed like Cheers). We had a great room with internal bath for only 95 euro per night and we could open our window and watch the neighborhood come alive in the morning. Easy walk to Vatican for an audience with the Pope Wednesday morning. Spend the money to take a tour (lines were horrendous); we got ours at 8 Germanico (forgot the name...SeeItaly?) and the guide was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: DenDonNW
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, cozy hotel within walking distance of the Vatican. Room was clean, reasonably priced, and the staff all spoke excellent English to assist with questions, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Just what was needed”
Reviews.Author: JoeyNi
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights as a solo female traveller in this beautiful little hotel very recently. I was very impressed with the surroundings, the location and the welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “HOT! No AC in August.....”
Reviews.Author: pdibona
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the San Pietrino for three very hot nights in early August. The room was small but managed to fit all five. A set of bunk beds, one twin and one queen. Clean and a bit too cozy...barely room for luggage. The bathroom was also small by American standards with the shower a tight fit for my large husband. The size of the room was fine with us, though, as we didn't plan to do more than sleep in the room. And there was the problem. Upon arriving, we learned the air conditioner was not working. Despite assurances from the somewhat sullen front desk staff that it would be repaired, the ac never worked. We did throw open our window for air but also brought in the sounds of the city at night. Tough to sleep.... I would not recommend this hotel for a summer stay. Hotel staff did comp us for the ac inconvenience to their credit. The location is excellent though. Easy access to the Vatican and Metro stop. Many caffes and restaurants. Tons of shopping. Loved Rome! Didn't love Il San Pietrino.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a very reasonable price, great service, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: GMan3909
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what others have described. Small hotel, on third floor (fourth to Americans) with a very small elevator access. Only a small sign out front tells you there is a hotel in the building and the rest of the building is used for apartments. Very different than an American hotel, as it has no first floor lobby. Hotel is completely on the third floor. Reception desk, rooms, everything. Hotel arranged for a driver to pick us up at the Fiumicino Airport and to take us back. This worked great and was reasonable, 40 euro each way. I forget to get receipts for these two drivers, but I wrote the hotel after I got home and they got me the recieipts I needed. Great Service! To American sensibilities, the room we had (a double) was small, with a Queen size bed and a twin bed at the foot of the main bed. No chairs to sit on to relax, but we only were in the room to sleep, as we were out seeing the sights for 16 hours a day. These roooms are for sleeping, not to "live-in" for long term. We had a private bath in our room. It was small, with only a shower, no tub. Our room was quiet and opened up on the front of the building. The air conditioning was on and worked well, so with the windows closed, no street noise bothered us. Windows did open up and were opened during the day, as the power to the room shuts down with no one in the room. The hotel is in a neighborhood, so not much nightlife here. A few restaurants are near the hotel, but much more commerce, shopping, etc. is about 6 blocks away toward the Vatican. Access to the Metro is just a short walk to the Octaviano Station. Hotel staff was very nice and we could communicate pretty good using a combination our very rudimentary Italian and their much better English.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: FeeBee2762
Reviews.Content: A nice converted apartment into tiny & I mean tiny rooms. We had one of the 'larger' suites for myself, husband & daughter & really you couldn't swing a cat in it. The bathroom was tiny too & my husband's beer gut only just fit in through the shower screen!! I mean it was tiny as in smaller than a normal bathroom shower screen. This 'hotel' is designed to make maximum profit for the owner. We were only there for 3 days & we spent as much time out of the hotel as possible as being in our room together with our teenage daughter was just unbearable. We travelled from Australia & the amount of luggage the 3 of us had took 3 trips in the elevator. Also the AC was turned off as Sept was no longer summer. It was very hot & we had to have the windows open so also got the noise too. Sleeping was difficult. I would only recommend this hotel to young people travelling or backpackers - certainly not older people & definitely not people with children. The staff were also sullen & couldn't be more unhelpful if they tried. I have read the other posts for this hotel & wonder if the other people were staying in the same place!! We were recommended the place by my sister who loved her stay there. However, it was just her & husband & also during winter time, so quiet & no need for AC & not busy either. We will not ever recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, great value for money, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: audiopink
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the Vatican. There is a nice family atmosphere to it. No breakfast but you can make your own tea/coffee 24hrs a day. We stayed in one of the two cheaper rooms with a private sink but shared bathroom, which was very clean and used by one other room only. Most rooms have a private bathroom anyway - just ask. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We were allowed to take bikes for the day for free - which was great. Free internet is included. All in all, great value for money - considering how expensive hotels in Rome are. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for a Rome Hotel - Clean Room, Safe Location”
Reviews.Author: PickyBudgetTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in May 2007 and again for 3 nights in October 2009. We liked the residential neighborhood location, and the proximity to the metro station makes it convenient to get anywhere in Rome. Yes, the bed was hard and the towels reminded me of tablecloth fabric, but the beds are hard at every hotel I have ever stayed at in Europe and their idea of a towel is not comparable to what we spoil ourselves with in the USA. The hotel is spotlessly clean and we found the staff helpful and accomodating on both visits. When we arrived in early October it was still somewhat warm out and after sleeping with the window open the first night and getting awakened by the scooter noise at 0600, we simply asked the staff to turn on the a/c the second night and they did so without any problem. The free wi-fi was a nice perk also. Lastly, they have a new sign on the street outside the hotel, but our cab driver from the airport still had a heck of a time finding it both times we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “No AC in September”
Reviews.Author: beamsofsunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while in Rome. It is located near Vatican City and is a short walk to a metro stop. We had a room with its own bathroom, which was small but nice. The biggest problem we had with this hotel was the lack of AC. We used the Lonely Planet Italy guide to find our hotels, and this one was marked with an AC symbol. While the hotel did have AC, no one let us know that it is turned off in September until after we had arrived. To top it off, the hotel is located across the street from a restaurant which was very loud at night. Since we had to have the window open, it was hard to sleep with the noise. The hotel staff did recommend a good restaurant for us to eat at (Bella Napoli), and the loud place across the street actually had a great meal as well (Osteria dell' Angelo). We were able to easily reach anywhere in Rome from the hotel. It is quite a walk to reach some of the attractions, but the metro is very easy to use and convenient. The hotel staff gave us maps to help us find our way.

Reviews.Title: “A dump”
Reviews.Author: PeOed
Reviews.Content: They say they have AC, guess what, they turn it off for the month of Sept. Check the temp. in Rome in Sept. Open the window for some air and hear the trafic and loud mouth Italians in the streets below. The walls are thin, at least to the next room's bathroom. I thought my head was in their toilet as the man took a leek standing up and when he flushed I looked for water on my floor. Top it off with grumpy staff and you have most of the picture.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a good location!”
Reviews.Author: palewriter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend a week in Rome just after Easter, and after seeing favourable reviews for Hotel San Pietrino both on Trip Advisor and in the Lonely Planet guide, we decided to go for it. The hotel is located on what is mainly a residential street (though there are shops and businesses too) about 10-15 mins walk from the Vatican. It's fair to say that it's on the outskirts of the city - any further out and you're completely out of tourist territory. That said, it made the area around the hotel pretty quiet, and you're only 5 mins walk away from the nearest Metro station (Ottaviano), which takes you right into the city. If you want to walk into the city, which we did several times, it's more like half an hour. The hotel itself is quite similar to one we stayed in a few years ago in Florence and is probably pretty typical of lots of Italian cities. It was originally a series of apartments and is located on the third floor - thankfully, there is a (very small) lift! The room we had was basic but fine, and certainly clean. We went for an en suite room, which had a very good shower. A couple of small negatives - there wasn't much in the way of wardrobe/drawer storage (we had one small cupboard for both of us) and the bed was a lot firmer than I'm used to, although I must admit it didn't stop me sleeping. In terms of amenities, the free wi-fi was great, as my husband had his laptop and we could look up how to get around. We also used it to make an advance booking for the Vatican Museums, the queue for which is usually horrendous. For those without laptops, the hotel also had its own computer for guests to check emaisl, etc. The room had a TV and DVD player, which were a bit old but workable. We took some DVDs with us because Italian TV is notoriously awful - not that you need to spend evenings watching DVDs in a city like Rome! The hotel's staff were very friendly (usually just one person working there at a time, it seemed), and booked us tickets for the Villa Borghese (well worth a visit) when we asked - though they did take some convincing that it was open on a Sunday! The hotel doesn't do breakfast, but there was access to tea, coffee and mineral water at all times. The first few days we had breakfast in a very nice neighbourhood cafe across the road, frequented mostly by locals; a cappuccino or orange juice and a pastry was 2euro. There is also a 24-hour bakery around the corner from the hotel, which does amazing cakes and pastries! In terms of restaurants, Angelo's is just over the road from the hotel, which we didn't go to but seems to have a very good reputation. It's also not far to a trattoria called Dino & Tony's, where we had one of the most memorable meals we've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Sidavouq
Reviews.Content: This tiny, inexpensive hotel (actually, a converted apartment) was generally clean and the staff was polite. Bring your own towel, theirs are clean but are towel-sized bedsheet linen. Decent location, not a bad neighborhood, close to a metro stop and 5 minutes walk from the Vatican. For Americans, without asking, they convert your bill from euros to dollars, so speak up before you pay if you would prefer to pay in euros.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't get one good night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: phreee1
Reviews.Content: The bed was very firm, hard even. The pillows were overly flat. The room was incredibly dark, and we couldn't open the window because our window opened into the laundry room/service area. We stayed in the first room next to reception, so a shared wall. All the walls are paper-thin, so we heard anyone who came and went, anyone who walked around the hallways. Additionally, the hotel owner lives on-site and has a baby who cried consistently from 7-9AM every morning. We were on vacation, so wanting to sleep in a little bit... The woman who cleans and manages reception in the mid-day was very short with us, and not helpful considering we were asking very typical tourist questions. It was an incredibly good location and value for Rome, but I would have spent a little more money to have a more enjoyable stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, with minor issues”
Reviews.Author: katiekate814
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel San Pietrino for 4 days in late March, and overall our stay was great. The room was clean, and there was a TV with a DVD player (which we didn't use, but still- nice touch). We had our own bathroom and paid 83 euro per night. The shower was small, but there was plenty of hot water. We were especially impressed that even though we kept the windows and shutters opened during the day and heard a lot of traffic noise, once we shut the windows the room was silent. The location is great- near a metro stop, but a quick walk from the Vatican and the best gelato in Rome- Old Bridge gelateria. The only problem we had was when we tried to check out- we wanted to pay by credit card in Euros, not in dollars (although we are American we figured our bank would give us a better exchange rate than the hotel) and the desk person couldn't figure it out. Other than that, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: babet09
Reviews.Content: I staid in Hotel San Pietrino with my partner a few months ago and wanted to include my very positive opinion of this hotel even at this later date. We staid for four nights at the price of EUR 68,- for a double room (bathroom outside, but practically to ourselves and very clean). This is a very pretty hotel, the rooms smallish but nice, and the staff is very welcoming and helpful. Its a budget choice, so dont expect too much, but if you want a simple and friendly accomodation, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Stellaxyz
Reviews.Content: This place is a great find. Not expensive at all for the quality of the accomodations. Great location, great staff (let us leave luggage while we were in Naples for three nights AND they printed out our boarding passes for the flight home). A little bit outside of the tourist hubub, but very close to the Metro lines. Short walk to Vatican, St. Peter's and Castel Sant'Angelo. Great little cafe across the street for morning pastries and espresso. Pizza by the etto next door. Stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but pricey”
Reviews.Author: CountryPlusPlus
Reviews.Content: This is generally a pretty nice hotel located in a nice area of Rome. You're very close to the Vatican and very close to a Metro stop, both very nice. First the plusses: Location is good, staff is generally friendly, quiet, free left luggage (in the hallway), hard but clean beds & sheets. The minuses: a bit pricey for what you get compared to elsewhere in Italy, no free breakfast, the crappiest towels I've ever had, and a shower the size of a toaster. I think for Rome this is probably above average, but it's a tepid above average and most places here are pricey.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Nina27London
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel after reading the review and seeing it in the top 5 hotel recomendations in the Lonley Planet guide. We paid 80 euros a night and for the 80 euros we could have booked last minute into a 4* hotel, but none of the 4* hotel reviews were as good as the San Pietrino and were so glad we went with the guide and stayed in the San Pietrino, this hotel is only a 2* because it does not offer a food service, but right out the door are plenty of places for breakfast, lunch and dinner, I have stayed in 4* hotels not as nice as this! The hotel is well located, Rome is pretty big so no hotel is on top of all the sights, but from this hotel we could get to all the tourist sights easy either on foot by train or the bus! The vatican city/St Peters is less than a 5 minute walk away. Although the train station is a 2 minute walk away and easy to use, we chose most days and evenings to get the bus, nothing is more that a 10 minute bus ride and you get to see much more. The hotel owner was great, he couldnt have done more to make our stay easy, he gave us all our directions, bus numbers, where the bus stops where to get it back etc he gave us resturant reccomendations and if we needed something ie toothpaste, hairdryer we got them in seconds! He even went out and bought a wonderful bunch of flowers which were delivered to our room, as a request from my boyfriend for my birthday! The rooms are immuclate and really cute, and made up every day, with air con, tv, dvd, really comfy beds lovely powerful hot showers etc, oh and free internet, you cant fault the rooms in fact I cant fault this hotel its location or Rome at all! If I was returning to rome I would not even consider booking something else! I would recomended this hotel to anyone going to Rome and I have friends from Australia are staying there next month! Oh one thing if your sightseeing make sure you buy a 20euro pack from the tourist information at the airport or one of them in the city, which gets you into the coloseum and saint peters and another castle which I cant remember the name of plus loads of museums along with 3 full days of free transport, buses and trains, definately MUCH cheaper than doing these things separate!! Hope this review has been of help to anyone visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwifella
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights and we were fearful of what we were going to find mainly due to the fact that it was so much cheaper than so many other hotels in the area but we were delighted in what we found. Snug but modern room, great bathroom and comfortable bed. The only complaint I have is that early in the morning we could hear people walking around upstairs above us but not a big problem. Friendly helpful staff, free internet, filtered water, great big windows with shutters, really great room and to top it off the area is really nice, close to the Vatican city and Metro. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel near the Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: mctweenigal
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights in Rome, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the San Pietrino. The rooms are slightly basic, but really good value (compared to prices we were quoted for the rest of Rome). We stayed in a double room with an internal bathroom (some rooms share a bathroom). The room was quite small, but very clean with a powerful shower. We had a window opening onto the bustling street- however, with the shutters closed this was very quiet. The San Pietrino is located on the 3rd floor, accessible by lift, and divided into two halves around the staircase. The larger half contains the check in desk (which you can only access if the owners are around or if you stay in that half of the building), a water machine and a PC with internet access during the day. The hotel is situated close to the Ottaviano metro station, which is situated on Line A of the metro (around 5 stops from Termini station). It takes approximately 30 minutes to travel to the Coloseum from the hotel by metro and walking. Where the hotel scores highly is its proximity to St Peter's Square, being at most a ten minute walk. It is even closer to the Sistine Chapel, only five minutes away which is very useful if you want to beat the crowds (we arrived at 8.45am and only queued for 30 minutes). If you're looking for a luxury hotel, then this isn't the place for you. However if you want a well-priced base for exploring Rome, with helpful hosts and a simple room, then I would recommend the San Pietrino without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Polinha
Reviews.Content: Great Location, great staff, super clean! It wasn't my first time in Rome, but surely was the best! The hotel you choose makes all the difference and this choice was the best I made.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: mjking40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in September. Was conveniently located for the Vatican and the Metro. Clean, comfortable and recently decorated room with decent shower. Good facilities - internet, etc. Restaurant opposite is good for traditional Roman food. Only drawback was allowing them to order us a taxi from the airport. This was quoted at 40 euros by the hotel, but actually cost 50, so would have been much cheaper to arrange ourselves. Otherwise excellent budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, nice staff, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Noche73
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I am surprised that someone said they could not sleep because I found it to be very quiet and I think it is hard to find a quiet hotel in Rome. The staff was so friendly and you can't beat the free internet. It was a short walk to the Vatican, but far enough away from all the tourists. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless nights!”
Reviews.Author: RH3107
Reviews.Content: I started out by thinking it was a good hotel, good location and decent prices....that was until I actually tried to get to sleep one night! Those reviews who say the rooms were quiet and comfortable must have been in a different room from where I stayed! Our room was tiny with no space to even put suitcases and with two people and two suitcases, there was no space to move. The walls are paper thin and I could hear people using the bathroom (even what they were doing in the bathroom!) all throughout the night. I would not stay here again and would not recommend it. R+S, London

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rock2bob
Reviews.Content: This was a great find! For 82 euros per night (with a shared bathroom) we stayed in a great hotel. It was located about 3 minutes from the Metro (just a couple stops away from the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps) and about a 5 minute walk from Vatican City. They have a bookshelf full of travel guides for their guests, plus a computer for guests (however it is only available from 8am-9:30pm). The room was spacious, well decorated and clean. The hotel is located in a very safe and quite neighborhood. We had a great stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: eebtraveler
Reviews.Content: Details: Has Elevator Has air conditioning TV with cable (no english) No Breakfast Room we stayed in: 313 Contact Info: Phone: +39 06 37 00 132, Email: reservations@hostelsclub.com, Web:sanpietrino.it/english/default.htm The Good This is a very recently updated hotel with lovely rooms. The staff was very nice and helpful. Room had central air and heat. Location was very nice. It is within a more residential area and within walking distance of the Vatican and the main areas in the city for shopping. The room and bathroom were both sparking clean. Definitely try the restaurant right across the street for dinner for a true Roman meal! Everyone that we met in this area of the hotel was just extremely nice and helpful – we only stayed one night but this would be a great base from which to explore Rome. It’s an excellent value. The Bad The double room was quite small. It was almost difficult to find space to open our bags. The bathroom was large however. You also need to be keeping a watchful eye out when looking for the hotel and walking from the metro. There is actually a sign that in the middle of the main road that you can look for that will point you in the right direction.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: im70schild
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel San Pietrino for 7 nights during March 2007. We had a very nice room (with bath) overlooking Giovanni Bettolo street. With the window closed, we could not hear the sounds from the street and the room was quiet. However, with the window open, it could be quite noisy. Additionally, the room was quite clean and nicely decorated, although small. But hey, I understand that most hotel rooms in Roma are small. The hotel does have wireless Internet, but is limited to 3-computers at one time. However, anytime that I was not able to connect to the wireless network, I asked the staff for assistance and they were able to help. The staff was attentive, especially Henry, who helped with making reservations for our tour of Museo Borghese. The hotel is a 10-minute walk to the Metro station and a 15-minute walk to the Vatican. Other than that, there is not much night life in the area except for a few restaurants. One notable restaurant for excellent local cuisine and an entertaining experience was Dino & Tony’s, which is only a 5-minute walk from the hotel. This hotel was great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “OK but some negative points”
Reviews.Author: olzovaro
Reviews.Content: Positive points : - Clean rooms (bathroom optional) - Generally, friendly staff - Well located, near a metro station and Vatican - good environment Negative points : - The hotel is an appartment so you can hear people coming late or leaving early in the morning. Noisy sometimes because some people use a common bathroom in the corridor. - Internet : when I came, the staff told me that I can use internet when I want. But when I ask for using it at 9 PM, they told me that I must use the computer only 5-10 minutes because it's late... - TV : Only italian channels in our room + no remote control

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelHarp
Reviews.Content: This was a sweet little hotel in a great location - 10 minutes' walk from the Vatican and the Metro station, with a lot of good neighborhood restaurants. Not a highly touristy area, but you could get wherever you wanted very easily on foot, bus, or metro. While the hotel is on the third floor, the elevator always worked. The staff were unfailingly helpful and positive. The only complaint I might have is that the beds are quite firm and I mean "quite firm." Other than that point, it was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Snug rooms and cheerful staff”
Reviews.Author: erbau
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel following the suggestions of the online Lonely Planet, and definitely it was worth our expectations. The rooms are nice and warm, but above all the staff is fantastic, they helped us in all our efforts to understand how to move around and what to see, visit, buy, etc. Spent beautiful time visiting St. Peter and the Vatican Museum, we even had a chance to see Benedikt talking to the pilgrims from his window, which was just 10 mins walking from ours! We are looking forward to our next travel to Rome (there's so much to see left!).

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: KiwigirlAuckland
Reviews.Content: We travelled around Italy for four weeks, and found that the San Pietrino was the best value for money. It is very close to St Peters/ Vatican City and metro stops. It was very quiet, clean and comfortable. The staff were especially friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to provide us with an enjoyable stay. There was use of a computer with free internet, washing services, shuttle to/from the airport and dvd player in some rooms. There were also yummy sweets at the reception desk. We recommend this hotel to budget travellers wishing to experience something special.

Reviews.Title: “Great small peaceful hotel”
Reviews.Author: alisonbh100
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and thought it a great peaceful little hotel in the middle of bustling Rome. It is spotlessly clean and stylishly decorated and we found the staff to be extremely helpful. They were kind enough to return my handbag which I managed to leave behind. We would highly recommend this hotel. It is great value for money for this location. Alison and Mark, Bristol, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nmn244
Reviews.Content: Hotel San Pietrino is a small hotel in a fantastic location only a couple of blocks from the Vatican. The room was a good size with bathroom included. The customer service from all the staff was great. This 2 star hotel is far better than some of the 4 star hotels that I have stayed in during my European travels. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Enriquez975
Reviews.Content: I have been in October in this hotel in Rome and my experience was very good. The hotel is really clean and staff that manage it has always been helpful and available. The hotel was full of tourists and it is not easy to find a room available. I will sure recommend to all my friends Enriquez

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff, Nice Hotel, Good (but quiet) area”
Reviews.Author: Timbo78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 5-10 min walk from the Vatican and Ottaviano metro station. The hotel is actually situated a couple of floors up in an apartment building in a quieter residential area. The area seemed very safe and free of the pick pockets Rome is known for. It was a bit of a walk to find a lot of the eating locations (e.g. Piazzo Navona) but still close enough to walk. The hotel is very clean and and well looked after. It is not luxury but the rooms are comfortable. We had a room with a shared bathroom. The shared bathroom was only shared with 2 other rooms so there were no problems getting access to it. What makes this place is the staff. They are extremely helpful, kind and go out of their way to make the Rome experience a good one. They even did our washing for us at a very low price. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly a proper value for money”
Reviews.Author: Keera
Reviews.Content: The hotel is generally not bad and situated in the vicinity of Vatican (excellent for those having early morning excursions). However if you've had enough of Vatican it is not convenient at all since you need to reach metro (10-15 min.) plus some 3-4 stops (another 10-15 min) until you reach the center and main attractions. Generally, not a long journey, but you won't have an opportunity to drop in for a shower or half an hour relax between the two sigtseeing/ shopping tours. Secondly, no breakfast is served and that was a problem, since you have to reserve some morning time to find the place to have your morning coffee (although the coffee in italian cafe's is much better than the one in the hotels), but still you need extra time and the worst of all: italians have there coffee standing and there may be even no seats (and if there are, you have to pay three times more for the same when seated). Thirdly, the hotel is not a hotel in the usual sense: it is an apartment in a residential building, refurnished into several separate rooms, and there is no hotel sign elsewhere, except for the one, which is very small, on the entrance door of the building side by side with the names of the other lodgers. So in spite of the map on the web-site we hardly found it. And the last remark. Towels (including bath-towels) were very thin and got soaked very quickly. The rest was quite nice (hospitality, linen, cleanness). For all these the price was not low - 105 Euros for a double with bathroom. Just for comparison: we paid the same price for the same type room in Venice (where we went after Rome), the hotel was located 5 min from San Marco (i.e. right in the center) and bathroom was much better equipped and towels were real Turkish. I would like to hold back from the recommendations but as for myself, next time I would prefer to add some 15-20 Euros per night trying to find more value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel - not too touristy”
Reviews.Author: lottiencol
Reviews.Content: As a family of 4 we were a little concerned about staying in a quad room but it was very spacious and extremely clean. As well as the restaurant across the road there was one a little way up the road (turn right as you walk out) that was very good value for money and friendly service- great local wine for 8 Euros. Washing is often a problem in Europe - this hotel washes and dries(line dried!!) for 9 Euros. Staff in hotel were very helpful and internet was free. The air conditioning was welcome for the hot July days. Family from Australia - children 15 and 12

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Hospitable, and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Bethers
Reviews.Content: Located a five-minute walk from the Metro and less than a quarter mile from St. Peter's and the Vatican, is the smallish, quiet hotel San Pietrino. This little place has a lot going for it, not the least of which is price and amenities that exceed the typical "budget category" hotel, like wi-fi'ed rooms. The rooms were pretty, but plain, with terra cotta floors, and they were maintained with spotless cleanliness. The staff were welcoming and kind, full of advice about Rome, and the location, which is of paramount importance in a city where you will wear out shoes walking to the sites, very hard to beat in the price range offered. If you stay here, you'll be only two Metro stops from Centro Storico. Only disadvantages I saw at all were the third floor location and small reception area, but there is an old lift, which should work fine for all but the laziest of travelers, and if you are one of those, Rome will wear you out anyhow! :)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gug23
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very quiet, very friendly, close to Ottaviano metro stop, walking distance to Vatican. No breakfast, but there is a fantastic bakery on your way to the metro stop - on Via Barletta, I think - you can't miss it, there is typically a line going downstairs from the sidewalk - with a large selection of inexpensive baked goods. Definitely will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet little safe spot”
Reviews.Author: Ziabaki
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a safe haven in the middle of a very choatic Rome. They provide lots of amenities for the price and really try hard to help you out so your stay is more comfortable. I must admit, the rooms are quite small and the beds a tiny bit on the hard side, but the location and friendly staff more than make up for those out points. Its located in a very safe and (keyword) quiet neighborhood near the Vatcian. It is also located very near a metro stop for ease in popping around Rome. They also provide a taxi service to and from the airport for 45 euros. Great bakery and a few wonderful restaurants right in the area. Our room overlooked a courtyard that was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “San Pietrino - they understand what hospitality means”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In June when things are in full tourist swing, this little hotel, located in a block of flats about ten minutes from the Vatican is an oasis of calm. Riding up the little cage elevator to the hotel suite was a bit like riding the elevator to visit Hercule Poirot -- tastful with a hint of mystery. Reasonably priced, a very helpful, friendly, and fun staff (bring them a small toy frog & you'll be loved). Food is not served. But there are many nice small & large & non-tourist places to eat and hang-out. Right across the street there is a Roman restaurant that serve a fairly typical Roman meal. I sat, ate, and drank wine all evening. And, with a staff of ex-Rugby players, I had no obsequious waiters to worry about. The Hotel is just far enough away from the tourist tracks to really be in Rome. Hotel is quiet and very clean. And, easy to get to. Great for singles, couples, and families. I cannot wait for my next visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel San Pietrino
HotelInfo.Address: Via Giovanni Bettolo, 43, 00195 Rome, Italy
